But in the meantime, their blackmailing me by sayingÂ Sthat-unless I call an election, then the taxpayers money can'tÂ Â be spent by the Australian Government to pay Public Servants,Â and soldiers, and Medibank, and students, and aged persons homesÂ o all these commitments.

There are two Houses of the Federal Parliament, the GovernrmentÂ is that Party or Parties with a majority in the House ofÂ Representatives. There can't be a Prime Minister or a TreasurerÂ in the Senate. It is not the Senate's function to decide whoÂ shall be the Government of Australia.

Now this amendment which the Opposition carried in theÂ Senate was done in reprehensible circumstances. This is notÂ the same Senate as was elected in May last year. The principle for which we are ' fighting is this: thatÂ a Government with a majority in the House of RepresentativesÂ is entitled to govern. I am thinking not only ofÂ the fortunes of my own Government, I'm thinking of ParliamentaryÂ democracy in Australia.
